Certainly! Here are a few examples of games that have been influenced by Ultima's open-world gameplay and character customization:

1. Gothic series: Gothic is a lesser-known series of open-world RPGs that take place in a medieval fantasy world. The game features a complex character development system that allows players to specialize in different skills and abilities, similar to Ultima's character customization.

2. Mount & Blade series: Mount & Blade is a medieval-themed RPG that allows players to create their own character and explore the game's open world. Players can join factions, command armies, and engage in battles with other factions, similar to the political system of Ultima.

3. Sea Dogs: Sea Dogs is a pirate-themed RPG that takes place in the Caribbean during the 17th century. Players can create their own character and explore the open world, engaging in naval battles and trading with other factions. The game's open-world gameplay and non-linear storyline were heavily influenced by Ultima.

4. Arx Fatalis: Arx Fatalis is a first-person RPG that takes place in an underground world. Players can create their own character and explore the game's open-ended dungeons, similar to Ultima's exploration-focused gameplay.

These are just a few examples of games that have been influenced by Ultima's open-world gameplay and character customization. There are many more games out there that pay tribute to the legacy of Ultima, and it's always interesting to see how new developers take inspiration from this classic series.
